result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy T Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $918.00 to David Wierdsma. Defendant given 12 months from his release date to pay restitution and costs. Alternate civil judgment.
Court costs to be paid within 12 months from his release date.

STRAIGHT TIME.
Credit for 50 days.

AS OF 11/14/2016: Court ordered an additional 35 days credit.

To defendant, proper appeal process has not been followed, please consult an attorney if further assistance is needed.

From defendant received 10/17/16 informing Court he would like to appeal the decision on sentence credit. 
Reviewed by Judge Maxwell 10/17/16; Wis. Stat. Sec. 809.30(2) has specific requirements for the filing of an appeal that a party must follow.  The Court cannot give you any advice on how to comply with that statute.  The documents you have filed so far do not meet the requirements of Wis. Stat. Sec. 809.30(2).

 9 months jail straight time. 50 days credit
